page.title: Static anode characteristic
page.description: Select a tube what do you want to use in your circuit. Look for a datasheet about this valve what contents a static anode characteristic and copy or print it. The static anode characteristics show anode current (Ia) on the y-axis, anode voltage (Ua) on the x-axis, and the set of curved lines shows the grid-to-cathode voltage (Ug).

page.title: Bias point of V1 electrontube
page.description: Determine ideal values of the power supply voltage (Ups) and quiescent anode voltage of V1 (Ua0=Ups/3). Sign Ua0 on x-axis. Select bias point (blue point). Read Ia0 and Ug0 values. Ia0 is common for both tube.

page.title: Bias point of V2 electrontube
page.description: Mark UB on x-axis (UB=Ups-(Ups/3)) and common quiescent anode current (Ia0) on y-axis. Ua0 of V2 is equal to half of the UB. Mark it too. Mark bias point in crossing Ia0 and Ua0 lines and read Ug0.

page.title: Load line
page.description: Draw a line from UB point via bias point to y-axis. Read IA value.
